flJYlUE3JrBwByb4wne-HQ.text: So I went here a couple of weeks ago for a friends birthday party. Inside it is really dimly lit. I remember looking through the menu and desperately trying to find something that I would like to eat. In the end I finally settled on two starters - garlic bread and nachos. The garlic bread was served vaguely lukewarm - it was pretty much cold when it arrived. The nachos also came served cold and were soggy. Both of these dishes were supposed to be served warm. I ate all the garlic bread but I could only stomach a few nachos - I just couldn't finish them they were so horrible. I mistakenly though dessert would be better. I ordered churros which were quite stodgy and some of them were a bit burnt around the sides. They tasted overcooked, old like they'd just been reheated. The chocolate 'sauce' was way too thick it was basically cold chocolate spread. For the amount of food you get on a plate and the quality of said food - it is ridiculously over priced. I know this is in Leicester square but I still think for what you get the food is waaaaayyyy too over priced. The only good thing was that the all the staff were darlings - they were really nice and friendly. Will never come back here again - the food was terrible and much too expensive.

fwDCssKgqGQzsQgy2dk-KA.text: Chiquito is one of the most visible establishments catering to the horde of tourists and locals that throng Leicester Square. It serves a combination of mexican and creole food.The place is usually very crowded. It is not unusual for people to have to wait for an hour or so during dinner time. This is usually a big turn-off for me ... and so i don't usually go there unless i am really craving to go someplace new.The food menu, as well as the cocktail list, is extensive ... though not very original. But that's not something i would expect in a place like this. The cocktails and wines are decent. The last time we visited we ordered a dish of meatballs and a plate of cheese nachos for starters. The meatballs were very much like the ones you get at Subway, except for some extra cheese. The nachos were delicious. However after we had ordered, they got us a complimentary plate of nachos. We would have ordered less had we known about this.Though the starters were good, the main courses were not upto the mark. I got the aztec jambalaya. It had all the requisite vegetables and meats that should go into the dish, but it just wasn't tasty. The dish was quite dry, and hence wasn't very enjoyable. My friend ordered the vegetable version and his was equally unpalatable. Another one of us ordered the "fiery chicken". This dish was probably better ... just that it was so hot that one could hardly get any other taste.All this cost us ~£23 per person. The food didn't deserve that much, even if you take into account the location premium. I guess i will go back to not making the effort to eating here.

YkPf-i0-B-ZG5td6ybziow.text: Wow! We should never eat Mexican food in London. This restaurant in particular has the worst Mexican food I have ever tasted. The service was the worst I've ever had. On top of the bad service, the  food was horrific and  way over priced. I would give this restaurant no stars but Yelp doesn't have that option so I'm gonna have to give it one star.

k9T6znyO8tCgLZh1fZbKPw.text: A mediocre Mexican restaurant located in right in the centre of Leicester Square. The decor is really tacky, there's Latino music constantly playing at a low level which can be a little off putting. As for the food, the nachos are a good option for a starter, the portions are really huge and great for sharing. Last time i went i opted for vegetable chimichanga, it wasn't that great but I'm assured the enchiladas are nice. Main courses cost around £10, ok considering your in the heart of London's tourist centre, but standard isn't great. Drinks are very pricey; house wine is as much as £5 a glass. Ok if you're stuck for somewhere to eat, but i wouldn't rush back here.

8jbTcg3PMLX0LitKTIPXhg.text: Those who have been to Mexico and are craving an authentic Mexican experience will probably hate Chiquitos. It is definitely more a Mexican theme restaurant than a serious culinary contender. However, having never been to Mexico and having no prior expectations (other than oh man, it's on Leicester Square, it's going to be overpriced and awful) I was pleasantly surprised. The restaurant is huge and well-staffed. They are clearly used to dealing with large groups, and handled our group of eleven with ease. We were rapidly seated and served drinks - they do a range of beer and wine and excellent value cocktails. To be honest the evening was bound to go well once one of my friends and I started on pitchers of Long Island Iced Tea, but even this was nicely made (and deceptively strong). The menu's got a variety of mexican and Tex-Mex favourites on it, from burritos to chimichangas, sizzling fajitas and quesadillas. Also burgers, ribs and all that sort of thing. All the food looked great- in a chain restaurant kind of way, and the sizzling steak fajita that I had was both large and tasty. Could have been more cheese, but when you've got a sizzling pan of meat and onions in front of you, Man Mode takes over and nothing else seems important. This is a great place to go with a group. It's not hugely expensive - there's something for everyone and, above all, it's fun. Don't go expecting a culinary revelation, but go with a group, have jugs of cocktails, chow down on some hot, tasty mexican-ish food and it's very hard not to enjoy yourself.

AwDYmoGcY4MLR6uLPxLyUQ.text: I don't know if being a study abroad student is coloring my views, but I have generally fond memories of Chiquitos tex-mex food, which as mentioned, is usually not authentic, but tolerable. I used to get the chicken enchiladas always followed with a frozen strawberry margarita. They were big and yummy and the type that doesn't taste like it has alcohol in it but after two you notice you're seeing double and starting to lose your balance (FYI this translates into THEY'RE AWESOME). Yes, the decor is tacky. Yes, it's not authentic Mexican food. Yes, it's in Leicester Square. But - if you're an American expat surviving on dorm food or late night trips to Sainsbury, Chiquitos goes down pretty good.

_2N7bQ_ZclOWhR2i_1JzIA.text: Tried Chiquito's for the first time as we had a 25% off voucher. Waited for at least 40 minutes for our main meals, which are really small portion-wise. The food is average, service was ok although there only seemed to be two waiters for the entire place and it's rather large. Toilets were cleanish but only one handdryer was working and some toilet locks were broken. Don't think we'll go back ......wish I had read the reviews before going there!

gd-GanncKyXyiuFd0_x1YA.text: So, i ended up here after wandering around the area and having heard that this place is alright (and it was friday night and this the only place with a bearable waiting time). BUT yet again just one more restaurant to add to the list of not good mexican food. I didn't have the highest expectations (bad mexican food experiences in london and it being located on Lleicester square) and sadly the food was rather bad. We ordered nachos to start off and were served a big plate of nachos, but with only a small scoop of guacamole and co (not nearly enough for all the nachos). Second I got the chimichangas and those I must say were pretty bad. Despite the fact that they are fried the chimichangas were super dry! I ordered the ones with fajita veggies inside and sadly I mainly had red onions and undercooked aubergine. I would not recommend this place. If you're dying for mexican food you're better of going to tortilla, chilango, and chipolte.

4tPIV14QUEvvs6Flc89Hlw.text: I heard good things about the franchise so a friend and I decided to check it out.  I know that it is a franchise but the standard at this place is so incredibly low I was dumbfounded.  Our server spent more time chatting with his coworkers than paying attention to his tables.  We ordered two items the Chicken Nachos and the Meaty Taco Tapas.  After waiting an eternity for our food to arrive, it arrived cold.  I was so angry and wanted to send both back but just asked them to replace the nachos as a third of the chips were burnt.  The taco tapas was a joke, there was no flavor in the meat at all and the funniest part was the ground beef serving, it was a bunch of gross sauce and one small lump of ground beef.  Location location location....that's all I can say about this place otherwise I'm not sure how they stay in business.  If it wasn't for the foot traffic that passed by there is no way that this place could survive.  If the service was half decent I would give them an additional star but our server really sucked.  I get that I was at a franchise restaurant and London is notorious for bad service but this guy just did not pay attention at all, after such a bad meal I didn't want to sit around waiting for him to get our bill so I asked a busser 5 minutes later drops the check off and then I had to walk up to him to give him our cc.  Never again, not even worth trying again.  It's not just good mexican food that's hard to find its good food in general that is difficult to find in London.  I'm just very thankful I didn't get sick from the experience.  Please save your hard earned money and go somewhere else.

uC_jq3gY00J4fAueZyd7PA.text: Here I was late and my friends had ordered and just started so I said Id have the same and it was on the table within 5 minutes. It was ribs, spilling over the plate with too much bbq sauce, some chips with coleslaw and corn but nice enough. The service  if anything was too fast when I was there.  He asked if I was finished when I was putting a chip in my mouth and was picking up my plate before I could answer and that just ruined it for me. The others had finished but I was late and needed more time.  Clearly the plate was half full. So Im thinking its like one of them places ; not too fancy get the customers in then out quickly. Im assuming its not an expensive place from the vibe Im getting and I just got what my friends were having so didnt check the price. £15.25. For that it wasnt a good meal because the ribs were nice but the sauce was too much and from a bottle and it was sloppy. If I paid  maybe £10.00 or less it would have been easier to digest .

Uyetula14xuJbA9W82_YpQ.text: I enjoyed myself in Chiquitos. The food was great. It wasn't to expensive and the service was propmt. I wouldn't say it is an authentic Mexican, but who cares when the food tastes so good! Did I mention you can order drinks by the jug :) :) :)

_Je3NYDzcCGhekbYwyPlJA.text: This Tex-Mex chain restaurant is no better or worse than the Tex-Mex chain restaurants you find in the States, which means the food is OK but a far cry from the real thing. If you're in the middle of Leicester Square and desperately craving a burrito or a platter of enchiladas, take a few minutes to walk to Wahaca (yelp.co.uk/biz/wahaca-lo…) for a far better dining experience.

PXyvOZlWxmXRQcGJBFaAxA.text: worst mexican food or food in general. it took them 1/2 hour to take our order after we asked at least 3-4 different people if we could get serviced. the margarita was nasty, the nachos looked and tasted nasty- I mean I can't say one good thing. if you read this- DON'T GO.

bVvq9mL2L40oYSCxl9WxFg.text: I wanted Mexican food badly enough to ignore my first impressions of Chiquito's and that was a huge mistake. Its not that the restaurant in Leicester Square looks that bad, its just that its haphazard seating system and cattlecar density in the dining room didn't bode well for the rest of the dining experience. Eating dinner with a friend, our drink orders took 35 minutes to get to the table. Once they did arrive, mine was wrong and took another 20 minutes to get back to me. It would have taken longer, I assume, but as our food was coming out, around the 50 minute mark, our waiter noticed my lack of an ordered drink and retrieved it from the bar. The food itself isn't that bad, but definitely isn't worth the wait. I had the chili tacos, which don't really qualify as traditional Mexican food, but did help to satiate my longing for such. The fajitas also appeared to be pretty tasty, as well as some of the appetizers. My only complaint with the food was the serving size, as my tacos came with only a scant amount of cheese and nothing that would pass as edible lettuce. Overall, Chiquitos isn't the worst place I've ever eaten in my life, by a longshot. However, the chances of me ever braving their indifferent and haphazard service for their average to below food is slim.

FXoA2uq6xt6gGOMZjfnftQ.text: Well I have to admit I love Mexico and Mexican food so this is a restaurant the I have visited many times with my partner and with various family members including children, and some older members who dont really do 'spicy food'. The MenuThis is split into the usual starters, mains and side orders on one side, and desserts and drinks on the other side of a big piece of card. The starters range from the particularly non spicy prawn cocktail, to an extra large platter of things like potato skins, chicken wings, jalapeno poppers and more, that we shared between 3 of us today and had plenty to eat. I usually have the jalapeno poppers filled with cream cheese, these come served with a jelly that is just so scrumptious.There is a large selection of main courses, of which I have tried many. The ones which come to mind as my favorites are the maple glazed salmon, two of my favorites, maple and salmon put together, you cant go wrong. It comes with rice, but not being keen on rice, got this swapped for fries, with no problems. My other favorite is the Acapulco chicken, very moreish. Hubbies favorite seems to be the chicken and ribs combo, which comes smothered in barbecue sauce. Now he is very picky about his barbecue sauce, but says that they have got this just right, not to spicy and not too sweet but sticky enough to coat the meat. Oh and we both like the burgers there as well, you can add or leave of toppings to get just what you want. There is a childrens menu, which is disapointingly not mexican based, but hey with kids you need to offer some things that they will recognise and eat. When we have taken kids there, we were offered a smaller portion of what was on the main menu if that was what they wanted.We have also taken some 'older' family members who definately dont like their food 'messed about', their words not mine, and even they have been happy and found something that they like within the menu. Desserts - my favorite part of the menu, well as usual there is cheesecake (my fave) comes with sumer berries, and ice cream. Today we had between us, a banana taquito (hubby) which is a banana wrapped in a cinamon tortilla, deep fried and served with ice cream and fudge sauce, judging by the way the plate emptied then it was a hit, I had the deep fried ice cream, which unfortunately is the only thing I have ever had that I didnt really like. There was nothing wrong with it, and it was served nicely, but just didnt appeal to my tastebuds, it is wrapped in cinamon flavoured crushed cornflakes and deep fried. It was okay, but not great, and I think a dessert should be great. If you are going to indulge in all those calories then it has to be worth it, and this just didnt make the mark with me.Service This was excellent, we went today, in the middle of a sunday afternoon and although the place was busy, we did not have to wait for a table, our menus were brought to us immediately and we had to ask for more time to peruse the menu when they cam to take our order. Our drinks arrived quickly, and when they were getting near empty our free refills arrived at our table without us having to ask for them.The food arrived promptly and was piping hot. I can honestly say that we have never had bad service at this restaurant. There were lots of staff on hand this afternoon to keep the place running smoothly and clean. PriceReasonable, we could have eaten cheaper at a pub or somewhere, but we like it here and it is not outrageously expensive. We spent £55 for a three course meal for 3 people including drinks, so I feel that is good value for money. Other stuffThis restaurant has been refitted since we last went and they have removed the circular booths which was my favorite place to sit so that is a bit of a disapointment, but has no bearing on the food or service. The toilets, very clean, plenty of soap, hot water and tissue, the ladies anyway, I didnt feel the need to check out the gents. If slightly confusing for my mother in law as the signs on the doors are in spanish, so we told her to make sure she looked at the pictures on the doors to make sure she didnt end up in the gents.Overall, we like this restaurant, and the type of food they serve so it will remain one of our favorites. Obviously the menu has a mexican slant, but you can find things on there if there are members of your party that are a little less adventurous in their tastes, and they should be happy. A good family restaurant.

ayk-rr01UOMSZH9nnd04Kw.text: Excellent casual Mexican right in Leicester square with outdoor seating which is great for people watching. Staff was friendly but service was a bit slow. Food treated great. The nachos were delicious and the tacos crispy and tasty. Good stuff.

bBsBqYc5QYnO5Cly3cLjCQ.text: Before you read my review I want you to understand that I was extremely excited to have Mexican food and that even a bad restaurant would have got at least 3 stars. I gave two stars out of pity. Saying that I want to say that next time I go to a fake Mexican restaurant in London I will be sure to translate the name first. Chiquito translates to tiny and that is the only way to describe their portion sizes. Not only is this restaurant stingy, overpriced and has terrible service but, they didn't even give us chips and salsa to start, instead they gave 11 pieces of cold salty popcorn (no refills). We ordered chips and salsa for an additional cost. Not only were the chips stale but the salsa tasted like marinara sauce and the sour cream tasted and looked like whip cream. The salads we ordered were extremely overpriced, they weren't even salads either, they were basically skewers with a few pieces of lettuce under them. They made it clear that everyone who works here has never been to Mexico or even the Southwestern United States for that matter.

Ofkoi8vnYYcFQaurNdAFVg.text: Was here for a Xmas party yesterday. I've been here before so obviously I avoided the "Mexican" items on the menu.  I understand Latin American food and I don't understand why Chiquitos don't sell any.  I ordered the safe option chicken melt, it had the taste and texture of a roof tile. No, really, supermarkets sell more succulent rawhide dog chews, I imagine it had been in the oven since the 1970s.  The rest of the blunders, spillages and culinary disasters are too numerous and depressing to mention.  If you are ever offered the choice between Chiquitos and a catheter, elect the medical option, as a bonus, hospital food is better than the nosh at this place.

PU2uBHp8pmmiYl5IAk1Jag.text: If only yelp gave us the option to give 'no stars' but I can settle for one star and that one star goes to the bar.I have been here twice and on both occasions I found that their customer service was really pants! First time me and my friend ordered a starter and a main, we waited 45 mins and this was during the weekday! Second time my friend accidentally dropped my pint of cola and spilt all over the table, we asked one waiter for help and he came back with a small bunch of tissues and walked off....uhm we spilt a pint of cola?!?! Then we asked another waiter if we could have a towel or something to clean up the mess...she looked at our table in disgust and tutted at us! We waited almost for our food to arrive and the quality of the food was not that great. Once, twice and third time lucky? No I don't think so!

x_MGJyqaro1k0i9Kca-GnA.text: One star: awarded to the cute waiter who finally brought us a bill for your mediocre faux Mexican "food."Never again.

YjEX4Qju9eeVZMz6X5nJOA.text: I really don't understand all these negative reviews.  I will not visit Leicester Square without stopping by Chiquitos.  I must have been in there 20 times in the past 12 months alone for cocktails and have eaten in there once or twice too.It's always busy, theres a great atmosphere and the staff are generally cool people.  When ordering cocktails at the bar, try to get the Eastern EuropeaN/Russian block lady, she is a cocktail flair champion and is just phenomenal to watch.  My only complaint about the drinks is that SOME of them i.e. Pina Colada are a little artificial.  They have a great selection of beers and other drinks though that are excellent...their frozen slushy margarita is delicious, they go down a little too easilly.The food, whilst I doubt anywhere close to authentic is tasty, not too badly priced and comes in big portions.I go here with friends, took my mum here on her birthday and have taken many different women here on dates....everyone loved the place.It's in the heart of Leicester Square and has the buzz to match.  Cool place, will be back in a week or two.

0UzoOfx1S5VdwKbAMMnWww.text: WORST restaurant experience of my life!! The service was AWFUL. We were in this hole 90 minutes for lunch on a slow day. When the food finally arrived, it was terrible. Clearly had been sitting under a lamp for at least 20 minutes. Complained to the manager but she could care less. AVOID this place - it really is terrible

KqqfnfPvV6kpdU2j8J8y8w.text: The presentation was very well but it lacked TexMex flavour.  The guacamole was bland and the salsa was definitely not Mexican inspired. Pricey as well. My Fajita salad was like fajitas on top of a very English salad. I've never had carrots in anything Mexican before so I will give them for originality.

WNck-8az9RiWB4N-TLmErA.text: I mean... it is what it is. Can one really expect good Mexican food in the middle of one of the most touristy areas of London? 2.5 stars.Atmosphere is kind of fun and decorative (in that Disneyland/TOURIST PLACE sort of way). Food decidedly mediocre, but... my expectations were very low coming in and it was edible enough.

UkaWptNKVYytFQ73bu7wQQ.text: Oooof, and I thought "mexican" couldn't get as bad as Chevy's in Times Square.  Congratulations Chiquito's you have beat them out in my book for world's stinkiest "mexican".  You can't really call this mexican but on the other hand I'm not sure what else you can call it.  I ordered the tacos and they came out on a piece of bread (ah corn anyone?).  What little salsa it came with tasted like very bad american pre-fab salsa (think Pace), and the service was extremely slow.  I know over here you really have to ask for your bill when you are done, but it's annoying when you have to literally get up to track down your waiter (who is so non-descript that you can't even remember which one he is).  There has got to be better mexican in the area in this, for sure there is a Wahaca in Convent Garden so when in doubt, hop, skip or just plain old run in that direction!! ;)

WZWYvirq6E24IDCKV-7-PA.text: Desperately craving Mexican, stuck in Soho and not knowing anywhere else new to try, I went here. First off, it is Tex-Mex, which is NOT Mexican food. It's American food with peppers, basically, and no where near what I was looking for.Regardless, I gave this place a shot. The service, as many have mentioned, was pretty poor. Even for being in touristy Leicester Square. I can see past service, service is easy to improve, even when it is bad. However, the food just wasn't to par, even for Tex-Mex. Maybe this is my fault for coming to a chain restaurant. I did like their nachos, but even those I've had better. The one redeeming quality of this place is that they have both Dos Equis Amber and Pacifico. If I am in the area and craving one of those and nachos, I will come back, but it is unlikely. Especially with Wahaca not for down the road. Hell, even Texas Embassy had better Tex-Mex.

DeKuIrzZ4846PBujhZvVzg.text: I love chiquitos, its a lovely Mexican restaurant and serves food with lovely flavours. they serve from rice to tortillas to burgers. There menu is great and it caters for everyone, they even a kids menu and options for vegeterians. They also have great desserts, I always get the irresitable waffles and ice cream, which just melts in your mouth, even if your full you will still want more. Definately recommend Chiquito's for those who are looking to try something new to eat on a friday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom

nUwQ2NuROaY1Do_gad9Vgw.text: CrapI should have paid attention to previous yelper's reviews. I wish I had!Food was ok. When it came out. We waited for an hour in between starter & main. Which is funny when the starter came out 5 minutes after it was ordered. I thought the other reviewers were wrong & mustve had an off day. But I was wrong.We had so many waiters we cudnt keep up with who we had to ask for our food or another drink etc.It's not funny really, but if u don't laugh you'll cry! We didn't leave a tip & won't be going back.

6awdamvKT2Jpl19bkOdOGw.text: All possible permutations of meat, salsa and tortillas. That's Mexican food in a nutshell. So if you haven't good good salsa and you haven't got good tortillas, you haven't got good Mexican food.You don't have to look any further than the chips and salsa at Chiquito to know you're not in for an authentic or particularly tasty Mexican meal. Good salsa is either chunky (e.g. pico de gallo) or smooth (generally spicier types). The salsa here is like the chunky salsa you get out of a jar in the supermarket, but probably not as spicy. Besides that, the chips taste stale.As if that weren't enough, the menu lists paella as a "Mexican Favourite." Last time I checked, they don't eat a whole lot of Spanish food in Mexico.I ordered a burrito on my first visit here. It was supposed to be spicy chicken, but it was just bland. And for over 11 quid, it was an awfully small portion.On my most recent visit, I just came in for a quick snack. I ordered a flauta (which is actually a taquito, they just don't know the slightest thing about what real Mexican food is), which came out ridiculously burnt on the ends and literally didn't taste like anything.The only redeeming quality about this place is a nice atmosphere. It's a large, nicely decorated space good for socializing.These guys are in trouble if Taco Bell runs a test market in London...

EtCgPUTY5trl6mV7fZ4YHA.text: With an upbeat attitude from staff on the word Go, Chiquitos is defiantly a most! From the spicy prawn starters to the hardest grilled Tacos in the whole of London Town. Although ive neva had a dessert from here the Cocktails are to die for. From the old classics such as Woo Woo to their own renditions of snake eyes. With Great service and Great prices Chiqutos is defiantly worth going to.

ecd5PO5fRtKLH3fkmwHYwg.text: I have found that customer service in England pretty much sucks, no matter what sort of business you walk in to.  This place was no exception.  Perhaps the hostess was new, we're not sure.  Either new, or just ridiculously lazy.  After we asked for a table, she went into the restaurant to check the availability.  She then came back to us, handed us our menus and said "go in and ask for table 34 or 35."   When I was in high school I was a hostess at an Applebee's restaurant and the tables were numbered...but that was for OUR benefit, so we knew what table to take the food to.  The customers had no idea what the numbering was.  Nor did we.  We walked in and wandered around aimlessly until we found a waiter who pointed us to table 34.  Our non-English speaking waitress wasn't the greatest either.  If she actually understood what we were asking for, it took forever to get it.  The food is alright--definitely not authentic Mexican, but it's not bad.  Nice veggie options as well.

4VWJ6M2CspOR48-sMPwlDg.text: Food is ordinary at best. I did not expect a lot from a Mexican restaurant in the UK. That said I did expect at least average Mexican in a city the size of London. I understand the Piccadilly Circus area is a bit touristy, but for the prices and location a person really deserves more on food quality and taste. If you're from America and desperate for Mexican do a bit more research, lacking that give it a try. Just don't expect much. Better Mexican can be found in most any small town throughout the United States. London and the UK has some great food, it just just doesn't exist here.

U1dTzbhdZvH-GeNGUx0UZw.text: I thought Vancouver had mediocre Mexican food. Well it does... but this was 10x worse! The ambience was cool and all and I can see why people would go there for that. But they couldn't even do standard tex mex correctly! They accomodated 18 of us, which was nice of them. Most of us got burritos or tacos or something. All of it tasted disgusting. And I can't believe I paid 2x as much for it than I do in Vancouver (due to exchange rate)!Of course, to get the gross taste out of our mouths, we HAD to go to Ben & Jerry's across the square ;)

gQHH6nmnkslwU2n_pRvmYw.text: Okay hands up I admit it, I've been here more than a couple of times. Why? Convenience. Whenever we are hitting up the cinema in Leicester Square and the boyfriend is being whiny about wanting hot meat and not sushi, we go here. But not anymore, it really is terrible and not cheap at all. The service is appalling, we were ignored by a lot of staff one night when I wanted to order a drink. They just bustle by, determined to avoid your eye. The food, yeah about the food. Standard Tex Mex, nothing special. Don't order tacos here, because what you get is so random - big thick doughy things. Eugh. The cocktails are good, you can just sit in the bar downstairs, listen to the booming Mexican music and enjoy a not-cheap pitcher of daquiris.

j7dZill1jvysU4TiU2NZlA.text: Nicely surprised by this restaurant which resembles an American diner with a Mexican theme. Good food and above all attentive service. The waitress really deserved her tip. Well done Chiquito. I also loved the festive decoration I look forward to going back. I thought it would be a tourist spot, therefore I was ready to find bad and overpriced food. On the contrary, it was a delightful experience! Gracias

uZsZoWKURnDwlbsePYP0Rg.text: OK... I knew this wasn't going to be great because it was in the middle of a tourist mecca in a country not exactly known for producing good Mexican food. But... we like Mexican food and were too tired to keep looking elsewhere. Still... getting a tiny thing of popcorn instead of chips and salsa should have clued us in that this wasn't gonna be very good. It wasn't. The salsa was too sweet, the kids both didn't get what they actually ordered, and the food was ok at best. I will say that at the end of it all, we got a nice dish of churros, and they were pretty tasty. But otherwise... not so great.

MHZvuaL9_O8wkl5gXd88ug.text: Don't even consider it. Crappiest service I have ever experienced. None of the staff cares, and you deserve to eat somewhere else.

X5IIuYZeE__0oqdjxxZLrw.text: Clearly a tourist place (where they only expect to see the customers once). The atmosphere is a mix of super loud Mexican pop (which I guess is ok for a Mexican restaurant ) and SkyNews on muted television. Watching earthquake victims being pulled from the rubble and other gory news bits don't exactly help the appetite for the adults in our party and made for some scary entertainment for the kids we brought. The food was boring and it didn't seem like any of it was actually made from scratch. The chicken was dry and the soft tortillas were hard.

jMj2MscXNepTrQ2pnAWjAw.text: I think Chiquito performs as expected for a chain with a larger, mismatched menu like this. I was with a couple of friends and needed a pre-theatre meal in the leicester square area, so Chiquito's was suggested, and as they had some veg options and I was hungry I went along with it.I ordered a black bean burger with chilli on top, sweet potato fries on the side, and a glass of Spanish wine. It was good, but not great. The wine was probably my favourite part. The service was good except for how long the drinks took - every time we ordered a drink it took at least 15-20 minutes, which is unusual. My friends agreed, it's overall A-OK, but nothing to get super excited about.

mOudljuCR0VGGiiGUU4i0g.text: Large restaurant with a nice atmosphere. Food is good but nothing special. Prices are high but this is Leicester square.

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. The interior

EICIVYbWJY8D3ThojZ-zsw.text: I know this might sound harsh, but this place is awful. I would NEVER recommend this restaurant if you're looking for Tex Mex food. To rattle off a few complaints, the salsa tasted more like spaghetti sauce, the margheritas were wayyy too sugary, and the quesadilla was just flat out underwhelming. There was nothing Tex Mex or even tasty about this food.Please don't go.

_pr2Wnvqy6FwkDr0Ilei7A.text: We popped in for lunch during some Christmas shopping and it was not that busy. The service was excellent and the food was good. It cost just over £20 for a plate of Nachos to share and I had a burrito and my daughter had a chicken wrap. For all the Mexican food conisours ( is that spelt right!) it may not be the best Mexican or most authentic but we liked it and it made a change from Italian or American food in the West End. It's a good location too.

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. The burrito was nice
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Chicken wrap was nice
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. The nachos starter

eYktEEKYwv54GmyVSpvNaw.text: Stopped in here for a quick bite to eat before the theater. Got seated within moments. It's very Mexican inside and has a fun environment. Out waitress came over right away and was incredibly attentive and friendly. We opted for the strawberry mojitos. They came right away. They were incredibly sweet, tasted like strawberry syrup. Not my cup of tea but I'll chalk it up to a difference in taste.For dinner we got the 15 quid deal for a starter and a main. Got the quesadilla bites as the started and the burrito as a meal. For better or worse the meal came out in approximately 2 minutes. We asked for both at the same time and both arrived together. The runner and the server were both amazing. The quesadilla bites were quite delicious. They seemed to be in some type of sauce so it was really something that had to be eaten with a fork and knife rather than finger food that could be picked up and eaten with your hands. Both were satisfying enough, but obviously more of a quick meal chain restaurant feel to it. The burrito came with tortilla chips (crisps), guacamole, sauce and sour cream. The one complaint is that the guacamole tasted bad. It was clear that it had chunks of avocado in it but it tasted really off... Like rancid. Not sure if the avocado went bad but even if that was the case it shouldn't taste like that. Overall we came in at 7:08 and had our bill paid by 7:33 so as far as a quick meal goes it wasn't that bad and not that expensive for two people. A+++ for the servers

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Entrance/bar
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Burrito
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Quesadilla bites

-CcCka3YM-JkaQfi-N40Kw.text: I was really disappointed by the food at Chiquito. My experience and service was great, but the rest left much to be desired. I was pleased to see an extensive list of gluten free options, but the quality and flavor of the food was pretty awful. I got the gluten free vegetable fajitas- the veggies were not that great, pretty bland, and the corn tortillas were not only cold but falling apart before I even began to make the fajitas. I went to a neighboring-ish Mexican restaurant and had a similar dish for a fourth the cost and it was leaps and bounds better!

89uBjHn8NThmeT5ka3d5nQ.text: an absolute disgrace to mexican food.  and the service was so bad that the dozy manager didnt even argue when we got up and left.

5azVR4aDedEsprmF9LMeWA.text: For Tex Mex, it's not bad.  In fact, you'd probably find places serving similar food in the states, but don't think that this is authentic Mexican food.  The Leicester Square location is always busy, but the service is very hit and miss...  trying to get another drink or get the check is can be a challenge in itself.The nachos are a good starter, but it is a large portion...  everything comes in large portions here.  If you are really hungry try the Chimichangas...  I uploaded a picture, but they are huge and I don't know that the picture accurately captures this.  And you get two!  If you want something a little smaller try the Santa Fe Border Wrap...  but skip the fries (they are kind of stale and limp) and go with chips and salsa instead.  If you want dessert, skip the churros.

q_sfY4krHKz_kgQ3HPcM-w.text: Ok, well here goes. The virgin mojito was what kept it from a zero. Salsa is very small, chicken wings are ok. The fajita is well don't bother. You have two choices. 1) go to Cantina Laredo up the road or 2) go next door to Burger King. But do not bother coming here for Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Mojito

gBHLPvvHiBmlhdUT0tYw_g.text: I went to the relaunch night after their makeover and i was impressed.The cocktails were flowing i had a strawberry margarita followed by a mango one then on to the obligatory salt shot lime lol.We shared a nachos while looking at the menu, the starters were nice but the nachos were the best, I had a rib eye steak , over done on the first go but they replaced it with a perfect steak no problems.Our waiter was very attentive and helpful. They also had a live band and dancers which was a great touch.A real difference from the last time i went, so i will def be back to see if its the same on a non launch night

zPRgwQIKyddez02OljRTNQ.text: Extremely disappointed with this place. We went in for appetizers and drinks, and after ordering both it took nearly 20 minutes for the waiter to come with our drinks. The appetizers took another 20 minutes, and we're absolutely terrible compared to many of the other Mexican restaurants throughout London. Don't waste your money, over priced and poor tasting.

O4Oe6Tennn227mUwnRi8Uw.text: Lively restaurant at Leicester Square, London, spread over 2 floors, with a Mexican restaurant standard menu and a varied children's menu.The taste of the food is okay. Nothing really special, and not cheap, but it is well cooked, Mexican food. In summary, I would say I was not really impressed, but there are worse restaurants than this.

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Kids menue

lpSsdfgWItriKe1fqhCGlw.text: I really like this place. I travel for business and while this is a chain restaurant they have a few really good items on the menu. I love the Veggie Volcano Burger. It is very tasty and made with black beans. I had this with sweet potato fries and could not have been happier. In the past I have had the fajitas with sea bass and it was delicious. The ambience is o.k but the bar servers are really nice.

tOLFaWIDq9si_5lWV-w8eA.text: .... don't even get me started.it was literally a painful experience to eat here, so i'm going to keep the review short for all of our sakes. the nachos had the tiniest sprinkling of cheese, so they were basically just a pile of crisps with the quacamole, sour cream and whatever else slopped on top, but no cheese :[ moving along, my friend got the enchilada for her entree and it was a very sad enchilada. they're supposed to be covered in sauce, like sitting in a little bowl of it and hers was just drizzled with it. this meant it was super dry and once again, they totally skimped on the cheese. my meal was actually okay. i got the acapulco chicken fajita (an assemble your own kind of thing) and it wasn't bad, although definitely not very authentic. the slow service and long waits to flag down our waiter for water and then the bill made it definitely not worth it though...chiquito - you suck

f6q4sOgmLruuE5u868_sSg.text: Don't expect good nachos, good salsa or good guacamole here.  And unfortunately those things should underpin a decent mexican place.  Having said that it was pretty inexpensive so I guess you get what you pay for.  Also our waiter was extremely nice, and when he asked how our food was and we (in our very British way) said 'fine' he looked almost surprised.It does bother me however when a restaurant offers 'oven baked nachos' on their menu, when in fact what they bring to your table are cold nachos dumped on a plate with jarred salsa, the kind of guacamole you shouldn't buy from a supermarket and other 'stuff' dumped on top.  Overall this is really a last resort restaurant and I'm sure there are many good mexican restaurants in London - avoid.

1kb1K4VfxVDvNY1HVeKOaA.text: Oh no no no...I've given this place a couple of goes.  The first time we'd been waiting about half an hour and when we asked about our food it transpired our order had been lost in the ether.  Never mind, these things happen.  So we waited about another 20 (hungry) minutes for our food and when it came out my enchiladas were burnt to a crisp on the outside and bland on the inside.The second time I popped in (yes, I was living in hope) everything turned up in good time and the service was very friendly, as usual, but I have to say the fajitas didn't blow me away.  Eat somewhere else and if you are a fan of Mexican food avoid this place at all costs.  Such a shame.

mo6_6Mo-J0oEdswW6lajig.text: Fantastic nachos and margs all day long. Definitely touristy but still yummy!

G2hJsAfubIwkAT3uav2slA.text: Just so-so. I looked at yelp after I sat down so my bad. It wasn't really bad just average and not much to speak of. The server was friendly and outgoing, it was pretty empty, but being that they are located outside the 02 they were waiting for the concert to let out. I did enjoy the decor of the place and they had great music playing.I ordered the chicken fajitas and a margarita. I didn't care for the margarita at all, In fact I left it untouched.

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom

GEoyjnkT2LCfb0IJj4me4A.text: Place looks small from the outside but it is big once you step inside. Very close to the theatre in Leicester Square. Service was amicable but the food was bland at best. We did enjoy the Mexican garlic bread. A tortilla loaded with melted cheese and garlic. It came with extra garlic sauce for dippingWe order a pitcher of margarita and it was enough for four small drinksWe also ordered the fajitas and a platter from the "street food" menu. It consisted of two chorizo croquettes with a pepper jelly, two very small quesadillas and two little tacos. Just because the food has tomatoes and peppers, u shouldn't call it Mexican.

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. The look from our table
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. From left: chorizo croquettes with pepper jelly, tacos and quesadillas
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Margaritas

iK4MMmkn-j71zFSra2Jz8A.text: We walked out of this restaurant after being seated due to poor services.  The waiter and waitress kept walking by without any acknowledgement. We waited over 20 minutes.  Then once we got up to start walking suddenly waiter asked if we wanted anything.  Politely, we declined as it was not worth our time after waiting so long.  The menu food prices were way over priced compared to other Mexican places in London.  Needless to say we were glad we walked out.  Too bad this place had a lot of potential.

sccr3nOpAPQeM00_n80K4g.text: The feta street tacos and nachos were amazing, and I liked the vibe.However it was s little slow (30 minutes from order to getting the food), and some of the other street food options were a little odd. It was also odd that a Mexican restaurant gave popcorn as an appetizer, having no chips and salsa.Overall decent, but a little uneven.

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Street food - vegetarian in front (feta quesadillas, halloumi, patatas bravas

RE987HLhRMa1g6k4WA-arw.text: When our London visitors suggested toddler friendly Chiquito for dinner, I tried to hide my utter disbelief with a nod and a smile.  My mind then quickly detoured to the wildly positive NYT review of Señor Frogs and I quickly reprimanded myself to not be a snob.  Surely if Señor Frogs could garner a good review, Chiquito's could maybe hold its own too?   Chiquito's was very child friendly but clearly, if I was only there for the food, the initial alarm bells clanging in my head were spot on.  They offer a very broad and extensive menu of bastardised Mexican/Tex Mex and American fare.  I ordered a vegetarian burrito which was bland and pretty boring and came with three pots of tinned salsa (think Doritos), sour cream and guac.  My partner ordered the beef burrito which apparently 'had no spice at all and was the blandest thing' he'd ever eaten.  The burritos were partially wrapped in a non-sensical wrapper which begged the question: how am I suppose to eat this -with my hands?  Unwrapped with a fork and knife??  Furthermore, the burritos were served on a board.  Why why why do restaurants continue to serve food on cutting boards??  There is a reason why plates were invented.On the plus side, the service was good.  They were able to get us a very toddler friendly booth and were really helpful in making sure we had everything we needed.  It's a good spot for kids - nothing too crazy foodwise and has enough space for them to run around when they can't sit still at the table any more.  Definitely worth the 'meh' food experience to have a bit of peace!Would I go back?  No.  If you are looking for a meal in central London, please wander up to Soho.  There are so many other options!

HTrwS2pCG6-7CZco8RW11g.text: The food is very overpriced for the portion size and quality that you get. The vegetable quesadilla was chili stuff in a tortilla with no cheese. The staff was not friendly and seemed annoyed to be serving us. Overall, very disappointed with the meal.

I9Ol8HmNPzKiN-KFQ16FDQ.text: I enjoyed the food at a good price because two people shared the three course meal option. But the service was too slow and the food took forever to come out. Give or expect yourself to spend about two hours there.

aPCZndwXNiH4mUuyx6wb6A.text: Only place open in the area. Stopped in at 11 for two incredibly weak margaritas. Upon notice, the female manager on duty, Ernesta, came over and argued with us about how that's the way they are supposed to taste and if we want more tequila we must pay for it. We told her they were incredibly watery and she said it's the ice. No kidding. She remade our drinks, this time with no ice, however still incredibly watery.As for the food, my enchilada was decent. My boyfriends tacos were below average.Would we come back again? No.

mxGPZwDyS8H839u5oaVBLQ.text: Nope,did not like it.The place is huge and confortable, big tables with a lot of room to sit.The food is not fresh and not that tasty, it is a tourist trap with expensive non-fresh food.The empanadas were not the same I had in america and the rest of the food is not that tasty, just a lot of flavours and condiment, maybe to cover the fact that their food is not fresh and not really tasty.sorry.The waitress is very fast and nice, but she keeps asking if you want order something else, they try to sell as much as they can, not a nice feeling though

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Chilli beef empanada

03_7ihFqtkX2vIrWgG-EJA.text: I should have known better given this place is in a tourist area... I ordered a burger (being from the states I wasn't sure if I could rely on finding good Mexican food in London).  I think the burger was the kind that is frozen and not made fresh. This was evidenced from the texture and color. It was edible but certainly not delicious nor good. Honestly, probably the worst burger I've ever had in my life.Additionally I ordered the margarita and I could not taste nor smell any tequila. Service was ok. The restaurant seemed popular but I would recommend NOT ordering the burger.

rhaOZFZHe71DAuaLm6gc8g.text: The only thing that saves this restaurant from receiving one star is the actual restaurant. The restaurant itself is cute and in a great location. However, the restaurant's food was not good. I ordered chips and guacamole as a starter. My chips were seasoned with something overly sweet and they were stale. The menu wasn't very big and the only chicken options were spicy. So I settled for BBQ chicken flat bread (only non spicy chicken option). BAD IDEA!!!!! The flat bread dough was fully cooked, but just barely and the BBQ sauce was disgusting. I left the restaurant hungry.

JxPP53C7ndvGMP1nop4cgA.text: Love the food in this restaurant although the deals could be abit more reasonably priced. The presentation was superb (as you can see from the pics) so all in all, it's the place to go for some Mexican fine dining. :D

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Churros and strawberry!
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate inside churros!! What more can you ask for?!
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Fajitas presented all lovely like.

zBSAyGlPbZSM6wHvu_t6yw.text: Our first and our last visit to Chiquito. The place was a little busy on the patio but not inside the restaurant as it was early for lunch. We were sitting on the patio. Sam was out waiter and he was not in any hurry to get to us. when we finally ordered it took forever to get our food. I had the Mexican frittata which lacked in flavor and moisture. I was hungry and started eating and by the time he checked back I was almost done and we needed to be somewhere so I just ate it. The chicken enchiladas that my wife had were pretty good for British Mexican food.The ambiance of the restaurant when we arrived was nice on the patio. there was music coming from one of the street performers - which was quite good. And then all of a sudden they turned on the Mexican Mood Music - loud Mexican Pop music (way too loud). When Sam came by (finally) to check on us we complained about how loud it was and he just said that that was they way"THEY" play it.Like Henrik A. says - they clearly are a tourist place and don't expect you back anyway.Anyway, I am from the US and don't plan another trip to London - but IF I did, Chiquito's would not be on my itinerary.

3zzwhWKcComN0Ay_H-dq1A.text: We were looking to waste some time before going to the theatre, and being lovers of Mexican food, we decided to give Chiquito a chance.Entering the restaurant, you are greeted by very friendly staff who swiftly guide you to your seat. If you are looking for a quick bite, this is definitely the place to go. Our food arrived within around 10 minutes. The portions are reasonable but unfortunately the food is incredibly bland. If you are a fan of Mexican food, you'll be a bit disappointed here. My pulled pork wrap had absolutely no spice in it and didn't really taste of much at all.

TVMZVsC5sWqejF7p1DTOOQ.text: Service : We booked a table in advance for Saturday at 8pm and with my experience with booking, the table is always ready to sit the crowd, person or couple. My family members were already at the restaurant and I was meant to get there a little later. I arrived at 8:10pm and they are waiting outside in the cold for the table they booked! As I'm the brave one, they sent me along with the tag to enquire about it. The lady told me that our table would be cleaned, 5 more minutes. We waited another 10 minutes until I spotted the manager and had a word with him.. He said another 5 minutes and my response was "that's what she said 5 mins ago". Anyway he promised that it would be done in 2 mins and luckily for them, it was. We were walked up to the table and served by a lovely blonde girl who was attentive the whole night. Nice, friendly, confirms order and whether we were still waiting. Of course, everyone got their starter and I waited another 5 minutes to her mine... 5 minutes and waiting seems to be the trend here. Complementary: Popcorn. STALE, COLD, NASTY! Drinks : Ok, I can't understand how a Mexican restaurant is bad at making cocktails especially margaritas. Maybe I've been spoilt in having really good ones and find theirs watered down and lacking the alcohol I paid for.. The strawberry daiquiri tasted like banana and strawberry smoothie. Food (Starters)I had the peri peri prawn as starters which was tasty and I also tried the other starters from family members. The BBQ chicken winds were tasty, the mushroom was good and so was the quesadilla. Food (main) : I had the San Pauli sea bass with Mexican rice and vegetables. It was a good dish but I wonder how long my rice and veggies had been sitting on the counter for before my hot sea bass on served on that plate... Cold rice and veggies.. No no no! Other members ordered baby back ribs, chicken and pulled pork dish served sizzling, steak served sizzling and chicken skewers which seemed to go down well. Their food is good and typical Mexican but elements of it really put me off like cold rice. Overall: The price is moderate for London but the service makes it expensive for that price.. If it wasn't for the waitress I wouldn't give much stars. Nevertheless, their food is tasty, it's extremely busy all the time and don't go to the central London branches. This joint may be good for crowds but it's not a place I would visit out of my own choice ... I think they are overpriced and don't stick to the principles of advance bookings ..

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom

Gs_mU9oKJfOyAqy3IpdCZg.text: Pretty standard of this chain Mexican restaurant.  Although I have to say their service has improved since the last time I was there.  I went here on a Saturday night and we were seated before the main rush, which was good as I know previously when there have been most the seats filled in the place, it can take some time for food and drinks to arrive and I think they have the knack of not employing enough waiter staff for the amount of covers they have.  The dinner that my friend and I chose was of a perfectly acceptable standard and decent enough for pre-theatre food.  It is never going to be a wow place and I would imagine a lot of their trade is passing tourists as opposed to die heard regulars.  If you want a standard dinner with standard service then it is fine.  Nothing negative really about my recent visit, nor anything particularly woohoo, but it did the job.

vWD7ktTjF28S5JUQZOnXvA.text: Love love love Chiquitos!! I came here for the second time at the weekend and was equally as impressed as the first time around (even though I ordered exactly the same things!). We got nachos to start - when we ordered we said we were sharing them so when they arrived we were surprised by the large portion, but when we got the bill we realized they had given us "sharing nachos" for about double the price even though we only wanted the small lot. Anyway, doesn't matter because they were lush! For mains I got BBQ chicken fajitas which are incredible. The meat, peppers & onions are brought to you on a hot plate, sizlling away. You are then brought wraps and a tray of the sauces and cheese etc. The BEST bit for me is that you can order more of the wraps and sides for free! The chicken is also ridiculously tasty. My boyfriend ordered the chicken and chorizo tacos which he said were delicious and he would definitely recommend them (I was too full from my 6 wraps to try his!)If you are a student, apply for their student card as it gets you 25% off food which is such a help! The staff are really helpful. Unfortunately our food was quite slow arriving this time but they were super busy and the ambience inside of Mexican music and sombreros means that you want to stay in there anyway!

photos.caption: Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. Chicken & Chorizo Tacos
Photo of Chiquito - London, United Kingdom. BBQ Fajitas

GMhFpGBu6f41Vsk_rtK6YQ.text: We had high expectations, but the food was mediocre. The waitress was friendly, but it won't make my list for a return visit.

UExIcKGVTK1WHLnppO8fdA.text: At 11.30pm on a Saturday night in Leicester Sq, its the only place we could get a table at. We actually wanted to order food, but were informed that if we wanted to sit outside, we could not get food as they were bringing the tables in soon. An hour later..and the tables were still outside..whatever. They saved us from ourselves I reckon. We had a couple cocktails, not so cheap, and of medium quality. I'd go again for a spot to sit and people watch!

LMW6RMtmQLLBo1yfZAkELA.text: Should have read the reviews before eating here. Service was fine, waited on promptly but I had to explain 4 times that I wanted to add vegetables to my vegetarian burrito.  But it's the food itself that's no good. This is NOT Mexican food.  Bland, boring tasting burrito.  How you mess up a rice and bean with vegetables baffles me.  With all the places to eat in this area, save yourself the trouble of eating bland food.
